extendedIngredients.name: canned black beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (15 ounce) can of black beans, drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: cooked shredded chicken breast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups cooked and shredded chicken breast (canned or rotisserie chicken works great in this recipe)
metaInformation: ( or rotisserie chicken works great in this recipe)

extendedIngredients.name: colby jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups cheddar or colby jack cheese, shredded

extendedIngredients.name: corn
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup frozen corn or a 15 ounce can of Del Monte Fiesta Corn with red and green peppers

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large segment of garlic, crushed (about 1 tsp if using jarred garlic)

extendedIngredients.name: smoked paprika
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ tsp paprika, I like smoked paprika

extendedIngredients.name: tortillas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 regular sized tortillas (you can use burrito size if you want)
metaInformation: (you can use burrito size if you want)

recipes.title: Sheet Pan Smothered Burrito

winePairing.pairingText: Burrito works really well with Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The Trombetta Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 59 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Trombetta Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: Rich garnet color. Aromas of vanilla, clove and cooking spiceswith hints of ripe berry, pomegranate and toast. Soft entry,balanced tannin and berry fruit mingled with pleasant acidityand lingering finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degreesLightly spray a large cookie sheet with cooking spray and line it with six of the tortillas, they should be hanging a couple inches over the edges of the pan. set asideIn a microwave safe bowl, combine the chicken, black beans, corn, onion, poblano pepper, garlic, rotel, cumin, paprika, salt and  of the can of enchilada sauce. Microwave for 4 minutes stirring half way through cooking time.Spread the mixture out on the tortillas you placed on the pan earlier. Be careful not to spread the mixture past the edge of the pan.Place the remaining two tortillas over the center of the mixture and then fold in the edges from the bottom tortillas to completely cover the chicken mixture. Sometimes I have to manipulate and tear pieces off to get it to be completely covered. Don't worry, everything will soon be smothered in sauce and cheese so imperfections will not show.Bake the big burrito for 15 minutes, remove and spread remaining enchilada sauce over the burrito and top with cheese. return to oven for 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted.Use a pizza cutter to slice giant burrito into squares and serve with your favorite sides: rice, salad, guacamole, sour cream, olives....

steps.step: Lightly spray a large cookie sheet with cooking spray and line it with six of the tortillas, they should be hanging a couple inches over the edges of the pan. set aside

In a microwave safe bowl, combine the chicken, black beans, corn, onion, poblano pepper, garlic, rotel, cumin, paprika, salt and  of the can of enchilada sauce. Microwave for 4 minutes stirring half way through cooking time.
Spread the mixture out on the tortillas you placed on the pan earlier. Be careful not to spread the mixture past the edge of the pan.

Place the remaining two tortillas over the center of the mixture and then fold in the edges from the bottom tortillas to completely cover the chicken mixture. Sometimes I have to manipulate and tear pieces off to get it to be completely covered. Don't worry, everything will soon be smothered in sauce and cheese so imperfections will not show.

Bake the big burrito for 15 minutes, remove and spread remaining enchilada sauce over the burrito and top with cheese. return to oven for 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted.Use a pizza cutter to slice giant burrito into squares and serve with your favorite sides: rice, salad, guacamole, sour cream, olives....
